page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Walton is a small seaside resort that with its neighbour Frinton became well known in the early part of the century,attracting many Londoners to the fine beaches.This particular area of Walton is better known for the Naze,an outcrop of the Red Crag which contains many unusual fossils and for its fine walks and views over rolling moorload.The backwaters are a haven for birds and sailors alike and also a wide range of plants and flowers can be found.The members of classes 5 and 6 of Walton County Primary School have enjoyed taking part in the survey and hope that you will visit our small corner of the country and find it as interesting as we have.
